text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that the determination of whether the drunk driver's actions were an intervening cause is partially dependent on how long the chair was in the road prior to the swerving (to determine whether the drunk driver could reasonably have seen the chair in time to avoid it without swerving). The candidate answer focuses heavily on the drunk driver's liability and the truck driver's emergency response, but it never discusses the time the chair was present or whether the drunk driver had a reasonable opportunity to avoid the chair without swerving. It treats the swerve as a direct reaction to seeing the chair, not analyzing the timing element required by the criterion.", "criterion_id": "53430ddb-2da1-464a-af19-ff799ad6064e"}
